intro: Psammogeton flabellatus, commonly known as the fan-flowered sandworts, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes or inland deserts. Its succulent leaves and adaptive features make it well-suited for harsh environmental conditions.
